title: Sanctioned Russian Tanker Unloads at Indian Port
summary: A sanctioned oil tanker has unloaded its cargo at the Indian port of Mundra despite the port owner’s order not to allow sanctioned tankers to dock there, Reuters has reported, citing ship-tracking data from Kpler and LSEG. The Mundra port is owned by Adani Group and, according to an earlier Reuters…

title: Oil and gas groups spend $500bn a year ‘to stand still’ as fields decline, says IEA
summary: Report marks a shift from energy watchdog that had previously warned of a ‘staggering glut’ of crude

title: The Rise of China and the Future of Clean Energy
summary: China has far outpaced the United States in clean energy spending, manufacturing, and innovation. And now, thanks to cheap and abundant Chinese solar panels and wind turbines, a growing number of emerging economies are joining the ranks of nations outpacing the United States in the clean energy tra…

title: Winter Gasoline Shift Pushes U.S. Pump Prices Lower Despite West Coast Spikes
summary: U.S. motorists are getting a reprieve at the pump just as the shift to cheaper winter gasoline begins, with GasBuddy data showing the national average price falling 3.6 cents over the last week to $3.12 per gallon. Diesel also eased 2.6 cents to $3.658. The slide comes as refineries ramp up supply …

title: Natural Gas Becomes Core to Middle East Energy Mix
summary: As global oil majors become more selective with their investments and prioritize shareholder returns, Middle East national oil companies (NOCs) continue to play a pivotal role in global energy security amid shifting market dynamics and the energy transition.
